content:
Context Class

In this Article

Defines an environment for the objects that are resident inside it and for which a policy can be enforced.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public class Context

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • Context

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

A context is an ordered sequence of properties that define an environment for the objects resident inside it. Contexts get created during the activation process for objects that are configured to require certain automatic services, such as synchronization, transactions, just-in-time activation, security, and so on. Multiple objects can live inside a context.

Classes are marked with an instance of the ContextAttribute class, which provides the usage rules. Whenever a new object is instantiated, the .NET Framework finds a compatible or creates a new instance of the Context class for the object. Once an object is placed in a context, it stays in it for life. Classes that can be bound to a context are called context-bound classes. When accessed from another context, such classes are referenced directly by using a proxy. Any call from an object in one context to an object in another context will go through a context proxy and be affected by the policy that the combined context properties enforce.

A new object's context is generally chosen based on meta-data attributes on the class. This mechanism is extensible through custom attributes. These are known as static-context properties, which are compiled into the class meta-data. Dynamic-context properties (also known as configuration properties) can be applied and configured by administrators.

For more information on contexts, see [<topic://cpconboundariesprocessesapplicationdomainscontexts>].

Constructors summary

Context()

Initializes a new instance of the Context class.

Properties summary

ContextID

Gets the context ID for the current context.
ContextProperties

Gets the array of the current context properties.
DefaultContext

Gets the default context for the current application domain.

Methods summary

AllocateDataSlot()

Allocates an unnamed data slot.
AllocateNamedDataSlot(String)

Allocates a named data slot.
DoCallBack(CrossContextDelegate)

Executes code in another context.
Finalize()

Cleans up the backing objects for the nondefault contexts.
FreeNamedDataSlot(String)

Frees a named data slot on all the contexts.
Freeze()

Freezes the context, making it impossible to add or remove context properties from the current context.
GetData(LocalDataStoreSlot)

Retrieves the value from the specified slot on the current context.
GetNamedDataSlot(String)

Looks up a named data slot.
GetProperty(String)

Returns a specific context property, specified by name.
RegisterDynamicProperty(IDynamicProperty,ContextBoundObject,Context)

Registers a dynamic property implementing the IDynamicProperty interface with the remoting service.
SetData(LocalDataStoreSlot,Object)

Sets the data in the specified slot on the current context.
SetProperty(IContextProperty)

Sets a specific context property by name.
ToString()

Returns a String class representation of the current context.
UnregisterDynamicProperty(String,ContextBoundObject,Context)

Unregisters a dynamic property implementing the IDynamicProperty interface.

Constructors

  • Context()

    Initializes a new instance of the Context class.

    public Context ();

Properties

  • ContextID

    Gets the context ID for the current context.

    public virtual int ContextID { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The context ID for the current context.

  • ContextProperties

    Gets the array of the current context properties.

    public virtual System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.IContextProperty[] ContextProperties { get; }

    Property Value

    • IContextProperty[]

      The current context properties array; otherwise, null if the context does not have any properties attributed to it.

  • DefaultContext

    Gets the default context for the current application domain.

    public static System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.Context DefaultContext { get; }

    Property Value

    • Context

      The default context for the AppDomain namespace.

    Remarks

    Every thread in an application domain for which a context is not explicitly set is considered to be running in the default context.

Methods

  • AllocateDataSlot()

    Allocates an unnamed data slot.

    public static LocalDataStoreSlot AllocateDataSlot ();

    Returns

    • LocalDataStoreSlot

      A local data slot.

    Remarks

    The slot is allocated on all the contexts.

  • AllocateNamedDataSlot(String)

    Allocates a named data slot.

    public static LocalDataStoreSlot AllocateNamedDataSlot (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The required name for the data slot.

    Returns

    • LocalDataStoreSlot

      A local data slot object.

    Remarks

    The slot is allocated on all the contexts. Named data slots are public and can be manipulated by anyone.

  • DoCallBack(CrossContextDelegate)

    Executes code in another context.

    public void DoCallBack (System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.CrossContextDelegate deleg);

    Parameters

    • deleg
      CrossContextDelegate

      The delegate used to request the callback.

    Remarks

    A callback can be done by calling the DoCallBack method on it by passing in a delegate. The delegate is used to request a callback. The delegate must be a CrossContextDelegate class type.

  • Finalize()

    Cleans up the backing objects for the nondefault contexts.

    ~Context ();

    Remarks

    For default contexts, backing objects are cleaned up during shut down of the AppDomain class.

  • FreeNamedDataSlot(String)

    Frees a named data slot on all the contexts.

    public static void FreeNamedDataSlot (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the data slot to free.

    Remarks

    Named data slots are public and can be manipulated by anyone.

  • Freeze()

    Freezes the context, making it impossible to add or remove context properties from the current context.

    public virtual void Freeze ();

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The context is already frozen.

    Remarks

    Context properties cannot be added after the context has been frozen.

  • GetData(LocalDataStoreSlot)

    Retrieves the value from the specified slot on the current context.

    public static object GetData (LocalDataStoreSlot slot);

    Parameters

    • slot
      LocalDataStoreSlot

      The data slot that contains the data.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      Returns the data associated with slot.

  • GetNamedDataSlot(String)

    Looks up a named data slot.

    public static LocalDataStoreSlot GetNamedDataSlot (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The data slot name.

    Returns

    • LocalDataStoreSlot

      Returns a local data slot.

    Remarks

    If the name has not been used, a new slot is allocated. Named data slots are public and can be manipulated by anyone.

  • GetProperty(String)

    Returns a specific context property, specified by name.

    public virtual System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.IContextProperty GetProperty (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the property.

    Returns

    • IContextProperty

      The specified context property.

  • RegisterDynamicProperty(IDynamicProperty,ContextBoundObject,Context)

    Registers a dynamic property implementing the IDynamicProperty interface with the remoting service.

    public static bool RegisterDynamicProperty (System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.IDynamicProperty prop, ContextBoundObject obj, System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.Context ctx);

    Parameters

    • prop
      IDynamicProperty

      The dynamic property to register.

    • obj
      ContextBoundObject

      The object/proxy for which the property is registered.

    • ctx
      Context

      The context for which the property is registered.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the property was successfully registered; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      Either prop or its name is null, or it is not dynamic (it does not implement IDynamicProperty).

    • ArgumentException

      Both an object as well as a context are specified (both obj and ctx are not null).

    Remarks

    Based on obj and ctx, prop is asked to contribute a sink that is placed at some location in the path of remoting calls. If multiple properties are registered, their sinks will be called in an arbitrary order that can change between calls.

    If obj is not null, and then if it is a proxy, all calls made on the proxy are intercepted. Otherwise, if obj is a real object, all calls on the object are intercepted. The ctx parameter must be null.

    If ctx is not null, obj must be null and all calls entering and leaving the context are intercepted.

    If both ctx and obj are null, all calls entering and leaving all contexts are intercepted.

  • SetData(LocalDataStoreSlot,Object)

    Sets the data in the specified slot on the current context.

    public static void SetData (LocalDataStoreSlot slot, object data);

    Parameters

    • slot
      LocalDataStoreSlot

      The data slot where the data is to be added.

    • data
      System.Object

      The data that is to be added.

  • SetProperty(IContextProperty)

    Sets a specific context property by name.

    public virtual void SetProperty (System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.IContextProperty prop);

    Parameters

    • prop
      IContextProperty

      The actual context property.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The context is frozen.

    • ArgumentNullException

      The property or the property name is null.

    Remarks

    Adding properties to the default context is not allowed.

  • ToString()

    Returns a String class representation of the current context.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A String class representation of the current context.

  • UnregisterDynamicProperty(String,ContextBoundObject,Context)

    Unregisters a dynamic property implementing the IDynamicProperty interface.

    public static bool UnregisterDynamicProperty (string name, ContextBoundObject obj, System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.Context ctx);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the dynamic property to unregister.

    • obj
      ContextBoundObject

      The object/proxy for which the property is registered.

    • ctx
      Context

      The context for which the property is registered.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the object was successfully unregistered; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The name parameter is null.

    • ArgumentException

      Both an object as well as a context are specified (both obj and ctx are not null).
